item.title: 商业团体表示，南非需要停止借口并解决增长问题
item.description: 南非当地的一个商业团体表示，南非需要停止为其表现不佳的经济寻找借口，而应研究其根本原因。【原文：South Africa needs to stop finding excuses for its underperforming economy and examine the root causes, a local commerce group said.】

item.title: Incora 法官对争吵不休的债权人规定圣诞节最后期限
item.description: 航空航天供应商 Incora 将在圣诞节前知道它是否能在主要债权人之间多年的争吵后摆脱破产，一名法官在为该公司设定新的重组期限时说。【原文：Aerospace supplier Incora will know by Christmas whether it can exit bankruptcy after years of acrimony among its top creditors, a judge said in setting a new reorganization deadline for the company.】

item.title: 阿根廷能源公司出售美债，米莱吸引投资者
item.description: 投资者对哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）总统的财政改革持乐观态度，因此阿根廷的能源公司纷纷涌入公共债务市场。【原文：Argentina’s energy companies are storming public debt markets to capitalize on investors’ optimism over President Javier Milei’s fiscal reforms.】

item.title: 丹麦在有史以来最大的海上风电招标中未收到投标书
item.description: 丹麦在其有史以来规模最大的风力发电招标中没有收到任何投标，该招标旨在到本十年末将其海上发电能力增加两倍以上。【原文：Denmark received no bids in its largest-ever wind power tender, aimed to more than triple its offshore capacity by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 俄罗斯取消通过受制裁银行支付天然气费用的要求
item.description: 弗拉基米尔-普京总统取消了通过俄罗斯天然气工业银行（Gazprombank）支付俄罗斯天然气费用的要求，缓解了人们对美国对该银行实施制裁将导致提前停止供应天然气的担忧。【原文：President Vladimir Putin lifted a requirement to pay for Russian natural gas via Gazprombank, easing concerns that US sanctions imposed on the bank would lead to an early halt of supplies.】

item.title: 英特尔与 Microchip 首席执行官、前 ASML 首席执行官共同组建董事会
item.description: 陷入困境的芯片制造商英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）正在寻找新的首席执行官，该公司在董事会中增加了两位半导体行业的资深人士，并称此举将带来 "经验和运营活力"。【原文：Intel Corp., the embattled chipmaker seeking a new chief executive officer, added two semiconductor industry veterans to its board in a move the company said would bring “experience and operational vigor.”】

item.title: 阿波罗开始交易蓝筹股债务以建立私人信贷 ETF
item.description: 据知情人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is focusing its new private-credit trading desk on investment-grade debt it has originated as the firm rolls out plans to bundle it into exchange-traded funds, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国共和党参议员恩斯特拒绝支持黑格塞斯，使饱受争议的被提名人陷入困境
item.description: 参议院共和党人乔妮-恩斯特（Joni Ernst）是一名退伍军人和强奸案幸存者，在军事问题上对共和党同事很有影响力，她明确拒绝支持皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth）备受争议的国防部长提名，呼吁进一步调查对他的指控。【原文：Senate Republican Joni Ernst, a combat veteran and rape survivor influential with GOP colleagues on military matters, pointedly declined to support Pete Hegseth’s embattled defense secretary nomination, calling for further investigation of allegations against him.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司和 Ecopetrol 希望将哥伦比亚的天然气储量增加两倍
item.description: 哥伦比亚国家石油公司（Petrobras）和 Ecopetrol SA 发现了哥伦比亚最大的海上天然气储量，如果该储量在商业上可行，将使该国的天然气储量增加两倍，从而有可能缓解该国的天然气短缺问题。【原文：Colombia’s biggest offshore natural gas discovery by Petrobras and Ecopetrol SA could triple the country’s reserves if the deposit is commercially viable, potentially easing the nation’s shortfall.】

item.title: 肯尼亚再次降息，通胀率已达目标
item.description: 肯尼亚中央银行连续第三次下调基准利率，通货膨胀率仍保持在目标范围内。【原文：Kenya’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate for the third time in a row with inflation remaining within target.】

item.title: 报告称中国关税将使加拿大收入小幅增长
item.description: 加拿大国会预算官员伊夫-吉鲁（Yves Giroux）在周四的一份报告中说，加拿大预计每年可从对中国钢铁、铝和电动汽车征收的新关税中获得约1亿加元（约合7140万美元）的收入。【原文：Canada can expect to collect about C$100 million ($71.4 million) annually from its new tariffs on Chinese steel, aluminum and electric vehicles, Parliamentary Budget Officer Yves Giroux said in a report Thursday.】

item.title: 以色列将在 2024 年通过网络和人工智能交易创下科技并购纪录
item.description: 根据 Vintage Investment Partners 的数据，以色列科技初创企业今年的并购额有望创下历史新高，因为加沙和黎巴嫩的战争并没有影响投资者的胃口。【原文：Israeli technology startups are on track for a record year of mergers and acquisitions, according to Vintage Investment Partners, as wars in Gaza and Lebanon didn’t dent investor appetite.】

item.title: 世界排名第二的锂矿开采商智利寻求新型开采方法
item.description: 智利是拥有最丰富卤水矿藏的锂生产国，在电池金属价格低迷挤压该行业的情况下，智利仍在寻求拓展新的开采类型，包括从粘土中开采。【原文：Chile, the lithium producer with the richest brine deposits, is looking to expand into new types of extraction including from clay, even as low battery-metal prices squeeze the industry.】

item.title: 波兰央行受能源价格影响推迟降息预期
item.description: 据波兰中央银行称，波兰政府决定在明年 9 月之前只降低能源价格，这使通胀前景 "复杂化"，并有效推迟了降息时间。【原文：The Polish government’s decision to reduce energy prices only until next September has “complicated” the outlook for inflation and effectively delayed the timing of interest rate cuts, according to the central bank.】

item.title: 麦格理支持的海上风电开发商 Corio 裁员
item.description: 随着整个可再生能源行业的公司都在努力削减成本，由麦格理集团（Macquarie Group Ltd.）支持的海上风电开发商 Corio Generation Ltd. 正在裁员。【原文：Corio Generation Ltd., an offshore wind developer backed by Macquarie Group Ltd., is laying off staff as companies across the renewable power industry try to cut costs.】

item.title: 芝加哥商品交易所将推出一盎司黄金期货以满足散户交易者的激增需求
item.description: 美国芝加哥商品交易所集团（CME Group Inc.【原文：CME Group Inc. will start offering a one-ounce gold futures contract in January to meet surging demand from retail investors amid bullion’s record-breaking rally.】

item.title: 特朗普对华关税计划存在 640 亿美元进口缺口
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺，他下个月上任后将立即对所有从中国进口的商品征收 10%的关税。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump has promised to impose 10% tariffs on all imports from China as soon as he takes office next month.】

item.title: 法国初创公司 Elyse Energy 为海事和可持续航空燃料项目融资 1.2 亿欧元
item.description: Elyse Energy 是一家紧密控股的法国清洁技术初创公司，该公司筹集了约 1.2 亿欧元（1.26 亿美元）的资金，用于生产绿色燃料，供化工、航运和航空业使用。【原文：Elyse Energy, a closely held French clean-tech startup, raised about €120 million ($126 million) to produce green fuels for use in chemicals, shipping and aviation.】

item.title: 首只共同基金背后的公司推出首只 ETF
item.description: 100 年前诞生了世界上第一只共同基金的 MFS 投资管理公司（MFS Investment Management —）终于进入了价值 11 万亿美元的 ETF 领域。【原文：MFS Investment Management — which birthed the world’s first mutual fund 100 years ago — has finally arrived in the $11 trillion ETF arena.】

item.title: 桑吉夫-古普塔的庞大钢铁帝国面临分崩离析的风险
item.description: 在过去的三年里，钢铁大亨桑吉夫-古普塔（Sanjeev Gupta）完成了企业生存的非凡壮举。【原文：For the past three years, steel tycoon Sanjeev Gupta has performed an extraordinary feat of corporate survival.】

item.title: 勒庞重燃预算协议希望，法国债券上涨
item.description: 法国债券涨幅扩大，因为人们希望该国能够设法结束数月来有关政府财政的政治纷争，这比许多投资者预期的要早。【原文：French bonds extended gains amid hopes the country will manage to put an end to months of political wrangling over government finances sooner than many investors had expected.】

item.title: 加拿大油田 240 亿美元抵御特朗普关税
item.description: 加拿大跨山输油管道的扩建工程耗资 240 亿美元，旨在帮助该国的石油生产商减少对美国市场近乎完全的依赖。如果当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）兑现他的关税威胁，那么这一赌注可能会比预期更快得到回报。【原文：The expansion of Canada’s Trans Mountain pipeline represented a $24 billion bid to help the country’s oil producers reduce their near-total reliance on the US market. That’s a bet that may pay off sooner than expected if President-elect Donald Trump follows through on his tariff threats.】

item.title: 谢菲尔德联队是最新一家同意美国收购的足球俱乐部
item.description: 一家美国财团已同意收购谢菲尔德联队，这是英超联赛之外最大的英格兰足球队之一。【原文：An American consortium has agreed to buy Sheffield United, one of the biggest English football teams outside the Premier League.】

item.title: 勒庞认为，如果马克龙放宽债务路径，法国预算将在数周内出台
item.description: 玛丽娜-勒庞说，只要下一任总理准备以更慢的速度缩小赤字，法国就能在 "几周内 "克服政府垮台的问题，完成预算。【原文：Marine Le Pen said France can overcome government collapse to deliver a budget in “a matter of weeks” — so long as the next prime minister is prepared to narrow the deficit more slowly.】

item.title: 韩国财政部长称经济衰退担忧 "过度
item.description: 韩国财政部长称，对韩国明年将陷入经济衰退的担忧是 "过度的"，他淡化了本周错误的戒严令将对经济或市场产生持久影响的观点。【原文：South Korea’s finance minister says fears the nation will slide into a recession next year are “excessive,” as he played down the view that this week’s bungled martial law decree will have a lasting impact on the economy or markets.】

item.title: 欧盟防长提出基于北约目标的联合债务融资计划
item.description: 欧盟国防部长提出了一个新的军费联合借贷机制，作为该集团在未来十年内寻求约 5,000 亿欧元（5,270 亿美元）安全资金计划的一部分。【原文：The European Union’s defense chief floated a new joint borrowing mechanism for military spending as part of the bloc’s plan to seek some €500 billion ($527 billion) for security over the next decade.】

item.title: 美国贸易赤字从两年多高点收窄
item.description: 由于企业减少了消费品和商业设备的进口，美国 10 月份的贸易赤字从两年多来的高点有所收窄。【原文：The US trade deficit narrowed in October from a more than two-year high as companies dialed back imports of consumer goods and business equipment.】
